Function reference

Derivations

Derivations add one or more variables or parameters to the input dataset and return the extended dataset.

derive_param_bor()
Derive Best Overall Response (without confirmation)
derive_param_clinbenefit()
Derive a Clinical Benefit Parameter
derive_param_confirmed_bor()
Derive Confirmed Best Overall Response Parameter
derive_param_confirmed_resp()
Derive Confirmed Response Parameter
derive_param_lasta()
Derives Parameter for the Last Disease Assessment
derive_param_response()
Add a Parameter Indicating If a Subject Had a Response before Progressive Disease

Computations

Computations expect vectors as input and return a vector

CDISC Hierarchy

ADEVENT

ADEVENT specific functions

ADRS

ADRS specific functions

derive_param_bor()
Derive Best Overall Response (without confirmation)
derive_param_clinbenefit()
Derive a Clinical Benefit Parameter
derive_param_confirmed_bor()
Derive Confirmed Best Overall Response Parameter
derive_param_confirmed_resp()
Derive Confirmed Response Parameter
derive_param_lasta()
Derives Parameter for the Last Disease Assessment
derive_param_response()
Add a Parameter Indicating If a Subject Had a Response before Progressive Disease
filter_pd()
Filter up to First PD (Progressive Disease) Date

ADTTE

ADTTE specific functions

Other Keywords

Source Specifications

Classes defining sources for derivations where variables or observations from more than one dataset are considered, e.g., like in derive_xxxxx()

Pre-Defined Time-to-Event Sources

tte_source objects defined by {admiralonco} that can be used as input for derive_param_tte()

death_event lastalive_censor pd_event lasta_censor rand_censor trts_censor
Pre-Defined Time-to-Event Source Objects

ADaM Datasets

User Utilities

aval_resp()
Map Character Response Values to Numeric Values
count_vals()
Count Number of Observations Where a Variable Equals a Value
filter_confirmation()
Filter Confirmed Assessments
filter_pd()
Filter up to First PD (Progressive Disease) Date
max_cond()
Maximum Value on a Subset
min_cond()
Minimum Value on a Subset

Checks

Warnings

Various
